channel.title: web server on Logotyp.us
channel.description: Recent content in web server on Logotyp.us

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Lighttpd Logo lighttpd is an open-source web server optimized for speed-critical environments while remaining standards-compliant, secure and flexible. It was originally written by Jan Kneschke as a proof-of-concept of the c10k problem – how to handle 10,000 connections in parallel on one server,but has gained worldwide popularity. Its name is a portmanteau of “light” and “httpd”. Source
You can download theLighttpdlogo on full-version of the page. ]] >
item.title: Lighttpd
item.description: lighttpd is an open-source web server optimized for speed-critical environments while remaining standards-compliant, secure and flexible. It was originally written by Jan Kneschke as a proof-of-concept of the c10k problem – how to handle 10,000 connections in parallel on one server,but has gained worldwide popularity. Its name is a portmanteau of “light” and “httpd”. Source

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
 Apache HTTP Server Logo
The Apache HTTP Server, colloquially called Apache, is a free and open-source cross-platform web server software, released under the terms of Apache License 2.0. Apache is developed and maintained by an open community of developers under the auspices of the Apache Software Foundation. The vast majority of Apache HTTP Server instances run on a Linux distribution, but current versions also run on Microsoft Windows, OpenVMS, and a wide variety of Unix-like systems.
You can download theApache HTTPlogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Apache HTTP
item.description: The Apache HTTP Server, colloquially called Apache, is a free and open-source cross-platform web server software, released under the terms of Apache License 2.0. Apache is developed and maintained by an open community of developers under the auspices of the Apache Software Foundation. The vast majority of Apache HTTP Server instances run on a Linux distribution, but current versions also run on Microsoft Windows, OpenVMS, and a wide variety of Unix-like systems.
